column4: hey guys I have a bit of an emergency anyone ahve experience with subversion?
Last night before I went to bed my SVN server was working fine, anyway this morning I tried to get my code from it and I get this error <m:human-readable errcode="2">
Could not open the requested SVN filesystem
</m:human-readable>.....my web svn is working fine and shows the code and every as still there
I did modify my SSH server last night would that be theproblem?
but I'm using http to host the repos
but when you do an update your doing it over ssh correct?
Well, ive not seent that error but I have had SVN get wierd on me related to ssh differences. So I would suspect that whatever you did with ssh is causing the issue.
You need to make that change in the svn configs too. See here http://www.techper.net/2009/01/11/changing-port-number-of-svnssh-subversion-protocol/
when im doing a regular svn grab is uses SSH ? i thought it only used http
Well if your doing it from the command line its using ssh. You may be adressing the dir of your repo which is in a WWW rood dir but the xfr is going over ssh
so like http://mydomain.com/svn/projectname and that was working great
sorry pal, I never used it like that, you have me at loss
